intro: Louteridium costaricense, commonly known as the Costa Rican louteridium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Louteridium costaricense thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests.
